algorithms

Class Rotate

  • java.lang.Object
    • algorithms.Rotate

  • public class Rotate
extends java.lang.Object
    Methods rotate the values in an array of numbers by a distance in terms of indexes.
    Author:
    nichole

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Rotate() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void reverse(int[] a, int idxLo, int idxHi)
      reverse the array between indexes idxLo and idxHi, inclusive.
      void rotate(int[] a, int left)
      The solution is O(N) and uses the pattern flip top sub-array, flip bottom sub-array, then flip all of the array.
      void rotate2(int[] a, int left) 
      void rotate2(int[] a, int n, int left)
      The solution is O(N) and uses the pattern of moving the first element out of the array and moving the subsequent shiftee's into forward shifted positions.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Rotate

    • Method Detail

      • rotate

        public void rotate(int[] a,
                   int left)
        The solution is O(N) and uses the pattern flip top sub-array, flip bottom sub-array, then flip all of the array. The problem and suggested solution are from "Programming Pearls", Chapter 2, Problem B.
        Parameters:
        a - array of numbers treated as a circular array.
        left - the number of spaces for which to shift left the values within array a.

      • rotate2

        public void rotate2(int[] a,
                    int left)

      • rotate2

        public void rotate2(int[] a,
                    int n,
                    int left)
        The solution is O(N) and uses the pattern of moving the first element out of the array and moving the subsequent shiftee's into forward shifted positions. The algorithm has many more lines than the rotate(int[], int) method, but it has fewer iterations. The runtime is at most O(N). Note that if left is a negative value, a reverse array before and a reverse array afterwards are added. For the current implementation, it is not better than rotate(int[], int) method when left is negative. TODO: the method could be improved for the case where left is a negative by writing different code for it, that is, code edited for left boundary logic and right shifts. The problem and suggested solution are from "Programming Pearls", Chapter 2, Problem B.
        Parameters:
        a - array of numbers treated as a circular array.
        n - the number of items in the array to sort (i.e. ignoring beyond index n-1).
        left - the number of spaces for which to shift left the values within array a.

      • reverse

        public void reverse(int[] a,
                    int idxLo,
                    int idxHi)
        reverse the array between indexes idxLo and idxHi, inclusive.
        Parameters:
        a - array of numbers
        idxLo - the smallest index of the range to reverse in array a
        idxHi - the largest index, inclusive, of the range to reverse in array a
